panels.description:
* Above 0: Write data bandwidth per filesystem and aggregated
* Below 0: Read data bandwidth per filesystem and aggregated

* Are there high data bursts?
Note: 
* max performance for fs1 is xx GB/s
* max performance for fs2 is yy GB/s
panels.title: Filesystem throughput

panels.description:
* Above 0: Write data IOPS per filesystem and overall
* Below 0: Read data IOPS per filesystem and overall

- The more IOPS the more CPU load and latency. 
- High IOPS, low bandwidth usually means small IO patterns (not great)
panels.title: Filesystem data iops

panels.description:
Metadata operations per filesystem-type of operation

- Which metadata filesystem has more IOPS?
- What kind of metadata operation is causing the load?
panels.title: Filesystem meta iops

panels.description:
Metadata operations per filesystem-type of operation

- Which metadata filesystem has more IOPS?
- What kind of metadata operation is causing the load?
panels.title: Client meta iops

panels.description:
* Above 0: Write data bandwidth per server
* Below 0: Read data bandwidth per server

* Are all servers equally loaded?
* Is there any kind of operation generating more load?
panels.title: Data throughput per ost

panels.description:
* Above 0: Write data bandwidth per server
* Below 0: Read data bandwidth per server

* Are all servers equally loaded?
* Is there any kind of operation generating more load?
panels.title: Data throughput per oss

panels.description:
* Above 0: Write data iops per server
* Below 0:  Read data iops per server

* Right side (thin lines): CPU load per server

* Usually the more IOPS the more CPU load
panels.title: Data iops per ost

panels.description:
* Above 0: Write data iops per server
* Below 0:  Read data iops per server

* Right side (thin lines): CPU load per server

* Usually the more IOPS the more CPU load
panels.title: Data iops per oss
